alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 10 at 4:57PM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SATURDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH AFTERNOON FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND EAST OF THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND RECEPTIVE FUELS... .Stronger west winds develop Saturday over more of eastern New Mexico where minimum humidities will range from 15 to 20 percent. Therefore a fire weather watch remains in effect. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) Saturday morning through Saturday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts near 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...15 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains
